建议.meaning: 商议；忠告 v. 劝告
examples: Mary counseled her daughter about good study habits.
I hope you didn't mention my name to her.

建议.mnemonic: of（一再）+fer（带来）→一再带来→提供
examples: Man proposes ; God disposes.
She recommended the book to her students.
Christians submit themselves to God's will.
The governor advocates building more schools.
The ballerina was acclaimed for her wonderful performances.
The clamour from the backyard drew us out of the house.
Bill inhaled the cigarette smoke and then exhaled deeply.
The wolf howled in the moonless night.
His cynical remarks simply show how uninformed he is.
The politician derided his opponents at every opportunity.
He flouted his mother's advice.
Don't make gibes about her behavior.
Don't jeer at the person who came last in the race — it's very unkind.

讽刺.meaning: 嘲弄 vt. 嘲弄，挖苦

examples: I was being sarcastic when I said this movie was thrilling.
Bill's sardonic sense of humor is often misunderstood.
James sneered at my old bicycle. He has a new one.
They taunted Tom into losing his temper.
My father discouraged me by ridiculing my performances.
If you always tease others like that, you'll forfeit the good opinion of your friends.

讽刺.meaning: / v. 嘲笑，嘲弄（deride, jeer）；藐视
examples: I strongly resent the conduct of aspersing other’s reputation.
I resent your casting aspersions on my brother and his ability.
The politician defamed his opponent in his speech.
Before you disparage this idea, give us a better one.
Dave's cruel jokes humiliated me.
He insulted her by calling her a stupid fool.
Haven’t I taken your part when you were maligned ?
To utter or spread slander is against the law.
